scenario_text.value: Ugh... Ah, UWAHHH!
Takuma! The professor’s here!
Is he seeing some sort of illusion?!

No, no I...I didn’t... I didn’t abandon
her...!

Professor! Come on, snap out of it,
Professor!
Hah!
*huff* *huff* *huff*...!

You’re drenched in sweat, Professor. Are you
okay?

I’m...I’m all right. I just lost my head for
a moment there.

I saw a vision... Although I suppose its
subject was too contrived to call it that.

That wasn’t just a hallucination...
It was crafted with intention.

Perhaps to hurt and weaken me? Drive me
into a corner, but without breaking me?

To think that I would be shown such a thing
as well... What could the reason be?

(The professor...seems composed, but a bit
frail, too. He must be exhausted.)

(Is he pondering this to calm himself down?
Or is all this thinking making things worse?)
(Hmm... Maybe I should stop him?)
(What should I do for him...)
Hear him out.
Watch and wait.
Tell him to chill.

Is it really all that strange that you saw
your illusion, Professor?

Doesn’t it just mean that these illusions
appeared for everyone who entered?

That may be it, but something about it
bothered me.

I’m not one of you children. I don’t have
a Kemonogami with me.

The enemy shouldn’t care about me; if
anything, I should just be a nuisance...

So when they kept me out of the library, they
should’ve just removed me from the equation.
Removed you...?
Put bluntly, they should have killed me.
And yet the enemy did no such thing.

Does that mean they see me as a potential
sacrifice? Or is there some other reason...?
Professor...

(He must be trying to calm himself down, in
his own way. I’ll wait and see.)

The enemy shouldn’t care about me. If
anything, I should just be a nuisance...

But then they could’ve just killed me when
they kept me from entering the library...
And yet the enemy did no such thing.

Does that mean they see me as a potential
sacrifice? Or is there some other reason...?
Professor...

Take a breather, Professor. You’ll just tire
yourself out thinking about it nonstop.
Ah, right you are... Pardon my outburst.

Your words have put me at ease, Takuma. As an
adult, I feel a bit ashamed to rely on you.

C’mon, don’t say that. We all lose our heads
from time to time.

You saw your own illusion, didn’t you? You’re
a strong kid, Takuma.
Takuma. I know I’ve mentioned it before...

About Miyuki being my sister, and Haru taking
on my appearance in my youth.

I had deemed this information unnecessary for
returning to our world...

Rather, I felt it too burdensome of a truth
for you all, and thus avoided the subject.

(Jijimon said it himself... That calling out
to Miyuki is a stopgap measure at best.)

(Sooner or later, we’ll have to defeat her.
If that’s true...)

(Then the knowledge that they’re siblings
would cause everyone to hesitate.)
Still, my assumption may have been misguided.

Renamon’s hatred, and the alliance with the
Master, may be related to my past.

If Miyuki is the key to saving everything,
then my circumstances are of no consequence.

That’s why if we get out of this library
safely, I want to tell everyone everything.

About me, my sister... Everything, from the
very beginning.
Professor... You’ve remembered, then?
Yes, indeed I have.

You have my thanks for keeping mum up to now.
I’m sorry for putting you in that position.

But first, we must get everyone back to base
in one piece.
All right.

We know where everyone is. All we have to do
now is escape together!

We still don’t know where everyone is.
Could you help us track them down?

Yes, by all means. Let’s give it everything
we’ve got.
